reflection_questions: Do you believe Elijah had full confidence in God when he challenged the false prophets to a showdown, or did he wonder if God would have his back?
What do you feel God is leading you to do that requires you to trust Him more?
If you feel God has ever let you down, what would be His perspective on the situation?
conclusion: Walking by faith requires the evidence of hope and an assurance you are clinging to in your spirit.

title: THE PLACE OF PROVISION

verse.text: The word of the LORD came to him, saying...

content.paragraph: Provision for what you are needing is always found in the place of obedience. What instruction is God giving you today?

Mature saints feed off the Word and whisper of the Spirit daily. Like daily bread, they are eager to receive direction from God on where to go, whom to call, what to say, and how to think as Jesus would think about a situation.
God doesn't give minute-to-minute directions, but He does like to be included when deliberating on the details of a situation.
God may not always answer on your timeline, yet when He speaks and you obey, He will be waiting for you in the place of obedience, and there is always provision where God is.

reflection_questions: What is the last instruction God gave to you?
Whom has God told you to talk to that you have not? Delayed obedience is the same as disobedience.
Where has God told you to go that you have not gone? God's presence is waiting for you in the PLACE of obedience.
conclusion: When you come to God with a need, He will give you an instruction to follow.

title: SUPPORT FROM GOD

verse.text: For the eyes of the LORD move to and fro throughout the earth that He may strongly support those whose heart is completely His.

content.paragraph: The Holy Spirit wants you to know the secret to getting God's support in your endeavors. It may sound counterintuitive, but the secret to getting God on your side is to get on the side of the situation that God is on.
A fully devoted heart is so precious to God that He has dispatched His Spirit to seek out those who are 'ALL IN.'
There is nothing more powerful for a saint than to have the confidence that God is on their side.
If the acid test of being 'completely His' is the entry point of divine assistance, is there anything you are holding back from God that, when given to Him, would make you completely His?

reflection_questions: In what way do you define being “ALL IN” for God?
If God were to rate your “ALL IN” commitment level on a scale of 1-10, where do you feel you would rate?
If you went “ALL IN” with God, what would you be capable of?
conclusion: If you went 'ALL IN' with God, what would you be capable of?

title: PAUL'S SECRET SOURCE

verse.text: I have learned to be content in whatever circumstances I am. I know how to get along with humble means, and I also know how to live in prosperity; in any and every circumstance I have learned the secret of being filled and going hungry, both of having abundance and suffering need. I can do all things through Him who strengthens me.

content.paragraph: Paul uses the word “secret” when describing how he has been able to bear the difficult circumstances in his life.
Paul's secret was to lean on the Lord. As the supplier of his strength, Paul learned to become dependent on God for all things.
Faith is voice-activated. Faith can rise up in silence, but when spoken out loud, it takes on new life.
When you say the words of the Bible out loud, the same power that dwelt in Christ is activated in you.

reflection_questions: When you are hurting, whom is your first call to?
What secret place could you adopt during your day to pray in private and receive strength?
What is your favorite Scripture—start by saying it out loud until you feel Christ rise within you.
conclusion: The secret to feeling strong is to stay plugged into the Source, The Spirit of God.

title: STRESS-ELIMINATING title

verse.text: The Lord is near. Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all comprehension, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

content.paragraph: Is peace a feeling to pursue? Peace is a Person, and Paul reminds us that the Prince of Peace is near to us.
To worry is to meditate on the problem and compound the pain. To turn our attention to Jesus, the Prince of Peace, is to receive relief.

In the middle of crisis, Paul encourages a battle-worn saint to: not to be anxious, recognize that Jesus is close by, put your request for help before God but come with a thankful heart, and peace will guard your heart.

reflection_questions: Is there anything you are struggling with that you need to bring to the foot of the cross?
What causes you anxiety throughout your day?
Who in your world handles stress and anxiety well—how do they do it?
conclusion: Anxiety is the byproduct of focusing on the problem; peace is what you get when you focus on the Prince of Peace.

title: PEACEFUL FEELINGS ON DEMAND

verse.text: Finally, brethren, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is right, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is of good repute, if there is any excellence and if anything worthy of praise, dwell on these things. The things you have learned and received and heard and seen in me, practice these things, and the God of peace will be with you.

content.paragraph: Your mindset will determine whom you attract. The Apostle Paul is giving two instructions. One instruction is giving us eight examples of what to occupy our minds with, and the other is to 'follow him' and his example. In concert with Paul's walk, we, too, can feel the way Paul feels and walk in the Spirit by focusing our minds on what Paul is focused on.

High-functioning people are able to create mental tracks for their thoughts to run on. By focusing their thoughts, they are able to self-direct their feelings in order to create performance on demand. Feelings are the fruits of focused thought.
Your focus will decide your feelings. William James, the American psychologist, once said, 'The greatest discovery of my generation is that we can change our feelings by changing our thoughts.'

section_title: EIGHT MENTAL STRATEGIES FOR CREATING INNER PEACE

list.title: What is true in your life?
What is honorable in your life?
What is going right in your life?
What is pure in your life?
What is lovely in your life?
What has a good reputation in your life?
What is excellent in your life?
What is worthy of praise in your life?

reflection_questions: How do you change your feelings at will?
What examples of compartmentalization can you practice on a daily basis?
Why does thinking on Paul's eight things usher in the presence of God?
conclusion: Feelings are the fruits of a focused thought life. Change your mind to change your emotions.

title: THE UPWARD CALL

verse.text: Not that I have already obtained it or have already become perfect, but I press on so that I may lay hold of that for which also I was laid hold of by Christ Jesus. Brethren, I do not regard myself as having laid hold of it yet; but one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and reaching forward to what lies ahead, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.

content.paragraph: What is your 'upward call'? Paul's upward call was that of an apostle. Your upward call could be that of a leader, a carpenter, a craftsman, teacher, or so on. Whatever your vocational assignment, that is your 'upward call,' which is also the highest and best use for your talents.
In order to be successful in his pursuit, Paul outlines a few strategies for goals associated with his upward call:
FOUR STRATEGIES FOR FINE-TUNING YOUR UPWARD CALL

section_title: FOUR STRATEGIES FOR FINE-TUNING YOUR UPWARD CALL

list.title: ACKNOWLEDGMENT
list.description: Paul admits he has not achieved his goal yet.

list.title: LET GO TO LEVEL UP
list.description: Paul says in Philippians 3:13 that he is willing to let go of the past.

list.title: REACHING
list.description: Paul's eyes are FIXED ahead, as he says in Philippians 3:14, 'I press on toward the goal.'

list.title: PRIORITIZATION
list.description: Paul points out an 'upward call,' signifying that there are other important callings he could be sidetracked by.

reflection_questions: How would you describe God's 'upward call' in your life?
What goals are you FIXED on, and which are you flexible on?
What is holding you back that you need to let go of?
conclusion: When God directs your goals, He sets a roadmap in place to achieve them.

title: GOD'S PATIENCE METER

verse.text: When the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, 'They have humbled themselves so I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some measure of deliverance, and My wrath shall not be poured out on Jerusalem by means of Shishak. But they will become his slaves so that they may learn the difference between My service and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.'

content.paragraph: Your behavior is a picture of whom you are obeying—pick your master wisely. There is a beginning and end to all things, including the patience of God. Everyone knows God's patience has its limits, but nobody believes it. If we did, we would live differently.

As you consider God's patience and the patience of those around you, do you sense an 'ending' or event on the horizon? Is there an adjustment you need to make today to change the trajectory of your behavior?

reflection_questions: Is there any area of self-correction you have been putting off in your life?
Who needs to hear the 'time is up' message in your circle of influence?
Why do we resist the signs to upcoming consequences?
conclusion: Everyone knows God's patience has its limits, but nobody believes it.

title: SEEKING BALANCE AND SELF-CARE

verse.text: Do nothing from selfishness or empty conceit, but with humility of mind regard one another as more important than yourselves; do not merely look out for your own personal interests, but also for the interests of others.

content.paragraph: Paul's instruction to put on a mindset of humility and to have an 'others-first' mindset is in response and contrast to those who were being driven by self-interest (Philippians 2:20-21).
If you only serve others while sacrificing yourself, you are out of balance and heading for burnout. It is not wrong to focus on yourself from time to time. In fact, it is even necessary.
Achieving balance is never permanent. How does a saint strike a balance in serving oneself and serving others?

reflection_questions: When was the last time you were confronted with the choice to sacrifice for another?
What example of balanced and out-of-balance seasons have you experienced?
In what ways are you taking care of yourself so you can be strong to serve others?
conclusion: Seek balance and settle for progress, for balance is a practice, not a 'set-it-and-forget-it' state of being.

title: BIG DECISIONS REQUIRE EXPERTS, NOT FRIENDS

verse.text: But he forsook the counsel of the elders which they had given him, and consulted with the young men who grew up with him and served him.

content.paragraph: Growth and wisdom often come outside of one's peer group. In one weighty decision, Judah split from Israel, and one nation became two.

Rehoboam misjudged the environment and followed the youth he grew up with vs. the wise counselors who had experience in counseling the king. Everyone gets over their head at some point in their career like Rehoboam did.
When you find yourself in the deep end of the pool, you will need an idea, a brainstorm, counsel on a decision, or an insight into a situation.

list.title: INVESTIGATE
list.description: Evaluate all the facts from multiple perspectives.

list.title: SEEK P.O.V.
list.description: Seek counsel from different points of view.

list.title: EXPERT INPUT
list.description: Who within reach has made this sort of decision before? Seek them out and gain their input.

list.title: ASK GOD
list.description: 'If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all generously and without reproach, and it will be given to him.'

reflection_questions: Whom in your inner circle do you usually turn to for advice?
Do you tend to seek out the advice of a friend or experts in the area of decision you need to make?
What was the last piece of advice God gave you when you sought Him out?
conclusion: Spending time with the wise makes one wise, and the opposite is true.

title: PROGRESS MANDATORY, PLATEAUING COMMON

verse.text: For I am confident of this very thing, that He who began a good work in you will perfect it until the day of Christ Jesus.

content.paragraph: God is a finisher. God is a fixer. God is a carpenter. As the architect in the soul of man, He transforms our character into His likeness while maintaining our uniqueness. As the old nature dies, a new nature emerges. God invests time to fashion you into the image of His Son. His ultimate goal is to imprint the image of Christ onto the tablet of your heart, so your desires, purposes, and pursuits are of the highest call. For that to be possible, God invites you to participate in the transformative work of becoming a new creation. With a willing spirit, nothing is impossible for God to accomplish through you.

God never bullies. He asks for cooperation and commitment, yet He won't force His way with you; you get to opt-in or opt-out. Many sinners and saints say “no” to God every day, albeit unintentionally. Consider some of the ways His master craftsman, the Holy Spirit, engages you in the process of divine transformation.

content.section_title: Transformative Act vs Required Cooperative Action

list.title: Obedience
list.description: Willingness to put God's desires ahead of your own.

list.title: Mental Recalibration
list.description: Willingness to turn away from thoughts contrary to Christ.

list.title: Conscience
list.description: Willingness to confess and repent without delay when convicted.

list.title: Correction
list.description: Willingness to adjust behavior and words to Christlikeness.

list.title: Identity
list.description: Willingness to let God define your value in Christ.

reflection_questions: Who is most Christlike to you?
What is God asking you to give up so He can help you step up?
Why is sanctification important in readying you for the day we will meet Christ?
conclusion: God never bullies. He asks for cooperation and commitment, yet He won't force His way with you; you get to opt-in or opt-out.

title: THE LORD WILL PROVIDE

verse.text: He said, 'Do not stretch out your hand against the lad, and do nothing to him; for now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from Me.' Then Abraham raised his eyes and looked, and behold, behind him a ram caught in the thicket by his horns; and Abraham went and took the ram and offered him up for a burnt offering in the place of his son. Abraham called the name of that place The LORD Will Provide, as it is said to this day, 'In the mount of the Lord it will be provided.'

content.paragraph: There is a place called 'The Lord Will Provide.' In every season of life, God sets the time, place, and manner in which we will be tested. God gives tests as a way of proving that we have persevered through the present season and are ready for the next. When you face a test, God is building a testimony. Abraham was about to face the ultimate test, the willingness to give up what mattered so much to him to show God that He still mattered most.

When you are doing what God asked you to do and doing it the way God asked you to do it, God provides. For leaders, He provides in many ways. Consider the ways in which you can rely on God to supply your need as you fulfill your vocational calling in the marketplace.

list.title: God can give you insight into a situation you are facing.
God can guide you on whose advice to seek when you are facing an uncertain situation.
God can give you title for the battle ahead or the business you are going to start.
God can show you where to sow your seeds so you reap the largest possible harvest.
God can open your eyes to see what He's already provided, like He did with Abraham.
God can reveal a creative idea to you that becomes a key that opens the door to success.

reflection_questions: With God as your provider, what are you trusting Him to provide?
Is there an instruction God is waiting for you to fulfill before He can do His part?
Which parts of your leadership have you turned over to God, and which parts are you relying on your own power?
conclusion: Through obedience, God will bring you to the place called 'The Lord Will Provide.'

title: THE PLANTER'S PROMISE

verse.text: Cast your bread on the surface of the waters, for you will find it after many days. Divide your portion to seven, or even to eight, for you do not know what misfortune may occur on the earth.

content.paragraph: The law of sowing and reaping can be seen in every walk of life. Jesus spoke of some seeds producing little and some producing more, but He instructed us to keep planting because we do not know which will return and in what quantity. The ability to persevere, not give up, and maintain hope when you see little results for your labor is a hallmark of a persevering saint. However, those who work as 'unto the Lord' have learned through experience that seeds planted using the Word of God will not return void.

It requires faith to plant and leave the return on investment to God. Thanks be to God that the One who waters our efforts and the One who moves the hearts of people is also sowing alongside us to accomplish His purposes in our lives.

list.title: God is your co-laborer in the heavy lifting.
Trust God to deliver the ROI.
Don't take rejection or failure personally.
Keep planting in good and soft economies.

reflection_questions: What is the heavy lifting in your profession?
Have you thought about teaming up with someone to help with the heavy lifting?
Have you ever asked God to show you the best ground to plant in?
conclusion: Planting with eternal purpose creates an eternal return from the Lord of Harvest.

title: BOOMERANG OF BLESSING

verse.text: With good will render service, as to the Lord, and not to men, knowing that whatever good thing each one does, this he will receive back from the Lord, whether slave or free.

content.paragraph: God's boomerang of blessing. Imagine God taking on the debt and promising to return to us a reward for our good works. In a startling statement, the Holy Spirit instructed Paul to teach us in Ephesians 6:8 that whatever good we do, God will do back for us. God wanted us to know that there was a promise that followed serving with good intentions from the heart.

God is a dealmaker who always gives more than He gets. And like a good Father, He will always stack the deck in your favor. He loves to hide blessings for you to stumble into. The Bible has hundreds of promises of God just waiting to be activated in your life.

Which promise of God do you need to activate today? Some blessings are free, while others require you to reach for them. What are you waiting on God for today? Is there an action He is waiting on you to take?

reflection_questions: Can you recollect a time when God returned a 'good outcome' to you for a 'good thing' you did for someone else?
Do you believe that you reap where you sow or that God allows you to reap in the place you need it the most regardless of where you sow?
Whom in your path can you do a 'good thing' for today and serve as 'unto the Lord'?
conclusion: God promises to bring a boomerang of blessing into our life as often as we do good for and to others.

title: THE 60-SECOND RULE

verse.text: Let no unwholesome word proceed from your mouth, but only such a word as is good for edification according to the need of the moment, so that it will give grace to those who hear.

content.paragraph: Your words create the atmosphere around you and feelings in others. Paul, in the 4th chapter of Ephesians, is teaching on the subject of “putting on Christ”—the new self. Specifically, Paul is asking us to ask ourselves, “What word of encouragement can I speak to the person in front of me right now that will build them up and enlarge them?”

Practice the 60-Second Rule. The 60-Second Rule says, “Say something nice about someone to them in the first 60 seconds you enter their presence.” Leaders are in the profession of words. Reading what to say and when to say it based on the need of the moment often determines whether a relationship advances or stalls.

Your words attract people to you or repel them from you. Master communicators always make it a point to edify their audience whether they are with one or many. Making others feel good in your presence will create a magnetic pull between you and them.

reflection_questions: Have you ever left a conversation wishing you had not said what you just said?
As you emulate Christ today, in what way can you edify another to build them up?
Who do you sense should be #1 on your list of people to edify today?
conclusion: Those who make a habit of making others feel good while in their presence become people magnets who attract larger degrees of influence.

title: SEASONS OF BARRENNESS

verse.text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun and it is prevalent among men—a man to whom God has given riches and wealth and honor so that his soul lacks nothing of all that he desires; yet God has not empowered him to eat from them, for a foreigner enjoys them. This is vanity and a severe affliction.

content.paragraph: It seems strange that God would grant a person all they desire, yet their soul remains unsatisfied. Have you ever wanted something so badly, and when you received it, it did not satisfy?

It is often the process, pursuit, or struggle in obtaining something that God uses to shape His character into us. Feeling 'barrenness' is the trigger to draw us back to our source and seek a fresh infilling of the Holy Spirit.

You are God's 'workmanship' created in Christ Jesus to do good works which He prepared in advance for you to do. (Ephesians 2:10) But it is possible to be so focused on the work that one forgets to enjoy the fruit of their labor.
If God has blessed the work of your hands and has filled your barns, yet there is leanness in your heart, consider asking Him the following questions:

list.title: What is missing in my life?
Why do I feel the way that I do?
Is the leanness in my heart Your way of getting my attention?
Is there a balance You are trying to create in my life that I am resistant to?

reflection_questions: Do you know people who have everything but are not satisfied?
How will God use a season of barrenness to grow a saint?
What do you believe God is trying to shape you into?
conclusion: Leanness in a soul can be a sign that a change of assignment is around the corner.

title: THE INSTRUCTABLE PERSON

verse.text: A poor yet wise lad is better than an old and foolish king who no longer knows how to receive instruction.

content.paragraph: Solomon makes an astonishing statement about being 'teachable.' The statement that it is better to be poor and wise than king and dumb is hard to understand.
What the young lad possesses is a teachable spirit that makes him 'wise.' If you are closed-minded, your lid for learning won't let anything in.
Age does not create maturity; continual learning does. WHY? Because environments are always shifting, and to remain relevant, you must adapt.
There is always something you don't know. If you maintain a teachable spirit, you will always be able to reach for and read new information necessary to succeed in an ever-changing environment.

list.title: OBJECTIVE
list.description: You are open to new ideas that are not your own.

list.title: AWARE
list.description: You recognize that there is always something you don't know.

list.title: HUMBLE
list.description: Your way is one of many ways, not the only way.

list.title: CREATIVE
list.description: Your first idea is not your best idea but gets better with others' input.

list.title: CORRECTABLE
list.description: You are not afraid to admit when you've made a mistake.

reflection_questions: Ask someone close to you if they perceive you to be teachable—what did they say?
Do you have a growth plan where you are pursuing new knowledge?
Are you only teachable when you are being corrected, or do you intentionally pursue ideas that are not your own?
conclusion: Age does not create maturity in business; continual learning does. WHY? Because environments are always shifting, and to remain relevant, you must adapt.

title: IDEATING WITH GOD

verse.text: Is there anything of which one might say, 'See this, it is new'? Already it has existed for ages Which were before us.

content.paragraph: It's not new, just new to you. Henry Ford once said, 'I invented nothing new. I simply assembled the discoveries of other men behind whom were centuries of work.'

Solomon and Henry Ford both were known for doing in their generation something that had never been done before. Solomon built a temple and a palace, and Henry Ford built cars; both ideas came from a place of inspiration.

God has thousands of ideas to help you in your life; can you hear them? A leader's antenna is always up to receive wisdom from on high of how God would inspire them to assemble or reassemble a series of ideas that could benefit them and those they serve.

Whether riding in the car, sitting quietly in a devo session, or kneeling in prayer, the successful saint develops an intuitive antenna that listens for the 'whisper of an idea' God may blow their way.

reflection_questions: What is God whispering to you today?
Can you distinguish the difference between intuition (a knowing from God) and intellect (a thinking of thoughts)?
What is the last idea you received intuitively?
conclusion: God gives instructions that will feel like an idea when He wants to birth something new in your life.

title: CONTROLLABLE VS. UNCONTROLLABLE

verse.text: What advantage does man have in all his work Which he does under the sun?

content.paragraph: God will one day ask for an account of what we did with “that which was in our power” to control.

Solomon spends the entire first chapter of Ecclesiastes waxing eloquently about the movements of the earth, the sun, and the sea. His conclusion is essentially that 'what will be will be,' and none of these elements can be changed.
Yet there remains a responsibility to influence factors that are in our control. Consider the abilities God gives to you so you can influence outcomes in your life.

list.title: Social
list.description: You do have the ability to decide which friends to associate with and whom to avoid.

list.title: Emotional
list.description: You do have the ability to work yourself up or settle yourself down.

list.title: Financial
list.description: You do have the ability to steward your resources, to say 'yes' to necessities and 'no' to wants.

list.title: Spiritual
list.description: You have the ability to choose when and how often you will pursue God.

list.title: Vocational
list.description: You have the ability to choose your career, work life, and path.

list.title: Purpose
list.description: You have the ability to discover and follow God's purposes in your life.

reflection_questions: What are the 'alarm bells' that go off for you when you realize you've lost perspective?
What strategies do you employ to help you to reset and get re-grounded?
What advice have you given to friends in the past to help them reset or consider another perspective?
conclusion: When facing an 'uncontrollable' in your life, giving it to God ushers in divine perspective and assistance.

title: DEFEND THE DEFENSELESS

verse.text: The righteous is concerned for the rights of the poor, The wicked does not understand such concern.

content.paragraph: God looks out for the little guys because they are the least likely able to defend themselves. In the same way God looks out for us, He asks us to look out for those He puts us in a position to protect.
Whom has God asked you to look out for? If you are feeling a burden to protect, look out for, or serve a person or group of people, it is likely God's heart is imprinting on yours.

When you feel compassion toward someone, it is often God's compassion coming through. In this way, He will allow you to feel what He feels so you will consider allowing Him to meet the needs of others through you.
Have you developed a trained ear to hear the needs in the marketplace? Successful saints are quick to identify needs, interests, and what people are focused on.

reflection_questions: If you had to make a list of God's top five priorities, what do you think they would be?
Whom are you being asked to help today?
What is God feeling a burden toward that He has allowed you to share in?
conclusion: When you care for what God cares about, He cares for what you care for.

title: CHANGE THE CHANNEL

verse.text: Like a city that is broken into and without walls Is a man who has no control over his spirit.

content.paragraph: Have you had the experience of catching yourself thinking over and over again about something you can't get out of your head? Like a tape that won't shut off, the internal conversation or scenario won't stop replaying in your mind. Yet, much like a start-and-stop button on a music player, there is a shut-off button.

Self-control can be difficult for anyone, especially for someone battling with multiple internal emotional streams all at once. God instilled within us a WILL to direct our mind, emotion, and spirit, and He gives us a heads-up when we've lost control or if there may be enemy infiltration.
What you meditate on is creating your emotions. Consider the following:

section_title: title TO CONTROL A RUNAWAY TAPE

list.title: Philippians 4:6-7
list.description: By prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all comprehension, will guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.

list.title: James 4:7
list.description: Submit therefore to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you.

list.title: 2 Corinthians 10:5
list.description: We are taking every thought captive to the obedience of Christ.

reflection_questions: How often do you stop down to scrub your thought life?
Do you have a title for calming internal chatter and getting yourself into neutral so you can hear God?
What habitual thought pattern does God want you to stop?
conclusion: The enemy's weapon is distraction—to busy you in such a way so you can't concentrate on the work at hand.

title: RELEASE THE ROPE OF RESCUE

verse.text: A man of great anger will bear the penalty, For if you rescue him, you will only have to do it again.

content.paragraph: I'm sure we've all heard some iteration of the following quote: 'Insanity, by definition, is doing the same things over and over again but expecting a different result.' I wonder how long it takes God and His angels to let go and let people 'learn the hard way.'
Letting a friend, coworker, or family member stumble is counterintuitive to our nature to 'people please'; however, the above verse from Proverbs promises a 'repeat' if we keep rescuing.
Sometimes you need to 'let the chips fall where they may' and let gravity have its way. Next time you catch yourself in an unproductive or unhealthy cycle, choose not to enable but empower.

reflection_questions: Is there someone you continue to rescue that you should not?
What is the worst that can happen if you release the rope of rescue?
What advice is God giving you now that would help you become an equipper who empowers and not an enabler of bad behavior?
conclusion: Pain can be a great tutor if someone doesn't interrupt the lesson.

title: GOOD VS. BAD RELATIONSHIPS

verse.text: He who walks with wise men will be wise, But the companion of fools will suffer harm.

content.paragraph: Environment often dictates who we become. Those whom we spend time around consistently imprint on us and vice versa. The company we keep contributes a great deal to what we believe, how we think, the decisions we make, and the actions we take.

The Right People in Your Life Will: 
• Believe in you. 
• Want you to grow past them. 
• Want you to grow in your purpose. 
• Encourage you to go the extra mile. 
• Want you to follow a path of success. 
• Set a good example for you to follow. 
• Challenge you to be more than you are. 
• Encourage you to focus on priorities.

The Wrong People in Your Life Will: 
• Foster doubt in you. 
• Want you to stay down with them. 
• Want you to just get by. 
• Want you to take shortcuts with them. 
• Want you to compromise on principles. 
• Want to keep you where you are. 
• Distract you from reaching your goals.

reflection_questions: Who is God encouraging you to spend more time with—and less time with?
Is there an influence that has entered in that is inhibiting your growth?
Do you have someone close to you that is being led off track by an influence around them?
conclusion: Never let people around you that you don't want to influence you.

title: CRACK THE CODE OF DESTINY

verse.text: The mind of the intelligent seeks knowledge, But the mouth of fools feeds on folly.

content.paragraph: Do you want to be considered intelligent, but maybe you lack a hunger for personal growth? Everybody is hungry for something; you just have to crack your 'hunger code' to discover your designed destiny.
To discover what subject God may be putting in front of you to pursue today, consider the following 'Heart Hack' questions to get you interested in the pursuit of knowledge.

list.title: What challenges are you facing right now?
list.description: These are an indication of a subject matter God wants you to pursue.

list.title: What things are you always thinking of?
list.description: Google the subject and see if a door of interest opens before you.

list.title: Who inspires you?
list.description: Read a biography on someone that inspires you.

list.title: What dreams did you have growing up?
list.description: Read how someone else achieved a dream you want to live or wish you had.

reflection_questions: What areas of interest is God flashing across the screen of your mind?
Other than yourself, who will be helped by you learning more in this new area?
How might God use a new area of growth in your life to bring you into a new future?
conclusion: As you put into practice what God is prodding you to learn, He breathes on your efforts and multiplies your return.

title: THE FOUNTAIN OF FRUSTRATION

verse.text: A hot-tempered man stirs up strife, But the slow to anger calms a dispute.

content.paragraph: Everybody gets angry from time to time. Anger is energy, and that energy can be used for good or bad. How you direct anger determines whether you use it to satisfy yourself or serve a greater purpose.
Consider the choices for how we can use the energy that comes from anger:

list.title: Productive Anger
list.description: An opportunity to create.

list.title: Unproductive Anger
list.description: A choice to destroy.

list.title: Productive Anger
list.description: A lesson to be learned.

list.title: Unproductive Anger
list.description: A lesson to be taught to another.

reflection_questions: When was the last time you experienced frustration or anger?
Consider how you used your last burst of emotional energy; did it help you or hurt your cause?
What mental triggers can you put in place that will remind you to redirect the fountain of frustration into a productive outcome?
conclusion: Like a rock in a slingshot, so is a believer who can harness the energy in anger to serve a greater purpose.

title: RIDE ON DIVINE TRACKS

verse.text: And we know that God causes all things to work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to His purpose.

content.paragraph: You must choose to stay on the ride. If you've ever gone to a theme park and ridden on a ride that rolls on rails, you know what it means to “go along for the ride.” You joined the journey, but you are not driving. Even the water rides at Disney run on underwater tracks that cannot be seen yet are directing the ride. So, who is directing your spiritual journey, you or God?

God will not do for you what He has enabled you to do for yourself. God works alongside us to bring us into His divine and perfect will, but He doesn't control us or make our decisions for us. He leads us, hoping we will cooperate with Him. However, if we get off track or His plan goes off the rails due to others not cooperating, He is able to guide us back onto the divine rails of His will if we follow.

list.title: God's Responsibility
list.description: Reveal the plan, Direct the plan, Provide feedback on our walk, Hold saints accountable, Rewards obedience

list.title: My Responsibility
list.description: Accept His plan, Walk out His plan, Course correct our walk, Accept responsibility, Be obedient

reflection_questions: How many times a day do you turn to God for divine guidance?
Who in your life models a cooperative lifestyle with God?
What is God directing you to do in your work life?
conclusion: If you can't hear God's voice, go back and do the last thing He told you to do. God only stops leading if you stop following.

title: THE PROSPERITY DRIFT

verse.text: So King Solomon became greater than all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom. All the earth was seeking the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom which God had put in his heart. They brought every man his gift, articles of silver and gold, garments, weapons, spices, horses, and mules, so much year by year.

content.paragraph: Is it easier to remain faithful when you are fighting through painful circumstances or coasting through the vineyards of prosperity in your life? Although we are faithless at times, God remains faithful. Solomon, in his later years, backslid by pursuing self-indulgent purposes. Solomon used the great wealth and wisdom God endowed him with to serve himself.
Over time, his appetite became his god. As God answers your prayers and raises you up in position, prestige, and plenty, remember the lessons of Solomon:

list.title: KEEP God first!
list.description: Solomon abandoned his first love.

list.title: SERVE others!
list.description: Solomon's focus turned from serving God and His people to serving his appetites.

list.title: PROTECT your environment!
list.description: Solomon was seduced away by endless enticements he surrounded himself with.

list.title: STAY single-hearted!
list.description: Solomon allowed his affections to be siphoned off into many different directions.

reflection_questions: What are the seducing forces in your life right now?
Whom can you confess your struggles to as a way of circumventing the enemy's title and strengthening your resolve to stay on track?
Is there someone who is wrestling with worldly temptations you could confront and bring back to God?
conclusion: Even seasoned saints can be seduced when their area of weakness goes unaddressed—who or what is your Kryptonite?

title: MASTER YOUR MIND

verse.text: My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.

content.paragraph: There are four voices within us that we need to be able to distinguish. Knowing their sound, where they are from, and their intent can help you to know which one to follow at any given time and which to ignore all the time.

list.title: God's Voice
list.description: When God speaks, you are inspired, your confidence grows, and faith comes by hearing.

list.title: Your Voice
list.description: Self-talk shapes your self-image. Replace negative self-talk with God's thoughts.

list.title: Others' Voices
list.description: Some voices are helpful, and some harmful. Take every thought captive to Christ.

list.title: Enemy's Voice
list.description: The enemy wants to control you. Resist him and he will flee from you.

reflection_questions: What is the last thing God has said to you?
What is the “talk track” in your head?
What is the last thing the enemy said to you to attempt to get you to follow him?
conclusion: Everyone has multiple voices of influence in their head; you must distinguish each one so you know who to listen to.

title: A PLACE TO PRAY AT WORK

verse.text: Then the Lord appeared to Solomon at night and said to him, 'I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for Myself as a house of sacrifice. If I shut up the heavens so that there is no rain, or if I command the locust to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among My people, and My people who are called by My name humble themselves and pray and seek My face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, will forgive their sin and will heal their land.'

content.paragraph: God has picked a place to dwell; have you picked a place to pray during your day? God agreed to Solomon's prayer by offering Israel a choice and a place in which He would answer their prayer—in the temple. Today, God doesn't dwell in brick-and-mortar buildings; He dwells in you.

Do you recognize when you are near to God? Believers know how to “turn it on and off” in business based on “who” they are around. When a customer or supervisor walks into the room, they turn on their concern, charm, and a hearing ear, recognizing that dollars and decisions about their future could be decided. God is “always on” and “always in” you, ready to assist you in every conversation and situation.

reflection_questions: What topics is God wanting to discuss with you today?
How can you set up reminders to stop and pray throughout your day?
Who in your life models a God-consciousness and a daily dialogue that you could follow?
conclusion: God is always last to leave the conversation; He desires a dialogue, not a monologue.

title: THE GREAT ATTENTION-GETTER

verse.text: When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because they have sinned against You, and they pray toward this place and confess Your name, and turn from their sin when You afflict them; then hear in heaven and forgive the sin of Your servants and Your people Israel, indeed, teach them the good way in which they should walk.

content.paragraph: Pain is often the megaphone that causes us to wake up to hearing the voice of God. C.S. Lewis said, “God whispers to us in our pleasure, speaks to us in our conscience, and shouts at us in our pain.” Sometimes a harsh word spoken, a blurry line crossed, or a wrong motive can cause the goodness of God to reach out and pull us back over the line so we are saved from creating a negative outcome in our lives.

Failure is the first step toward success when it brings us back to our faith in God. God raises up successful saints in the marketplace to be rainmakers. Yet in that success, His voice can get drowned out when the rains of success take His place.

God desires that we reach for Him in our pain or self-made mess so He can help us to discover a solution. He will allow events to transpire in our lives as an “attention-getter,” then use them to bring us back to relationship… if we let Him.

reflection_questions: What “attention-getters” has God used in your life before?
Is God using anything in your life right now to get your attention?
Can you think of a time when God used lackluster results in your life as a way to draw you in so He could speak with you?
conclusion: Your pain point is a “calendar invite” sent from God so He can help you out of your situation.

title: RELATIONSHIPS BUILT TO LAST

verse.text: Yet have regard to the prayer of Your servant and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which Your servant prays before You today; that Your eyes may be open toward this house night and day, toward the place of which You have said, 'My name shall be there,' to listen to the prayer which Your servant shall pray toward this place.

content.paragraph: Once Solomon finished the building of the temple, God filled the place with His glory as a symbol of His arrival, His presence, and His availability. God's promise to hear from on high when we turn to Him is matched by His kind reaction to us when we approach Him with a sincere heart requesting help, forgiveness, or a turnaround.
When we draw near to God, He draws near to us. What creates this accessibility? A willingness to be available in a time of need.

Your accessibility shows that you care. People want someone they can count on, not someone they have to hunt down in a time of need. Dependability precedes a reputation for reliability for those laboring in the marketplace.

Following God's example, consider making a promise to those you serve to be there when they need you. A promise to be there for someone in their time of need creates a bond of trust, and delivering on a promise is what fortifies the trust.

Whether through email, phone, or a text, being ready and willing to help when someone is in need creates repeat business from customers, loyalty from employees, and relationships that are built to last.

reflection_questions: Who in your world may be feeling neglected that you have access to?
Is there someone you can make yourself more available to at work, at home, or in the church?
What advice would you give to someone as to how they can strengthen a relationship?
conclusion: People gravitate toward people who make themselves accessible in a time of need.

title: RESOURCES WITHIN REACH

verse.text: Now send me a skilled man to work in gold, silver, brass and iron, and in purple, crimson and violet fabrics, and who knows how to make engravings, to work with the skilled men whom I have in Judah and Jerusalem, whom David my father provided. Send me also cedar, cypress and algum timber from Lebanon, for I know that your servants know how to cut timber of Lebanon; and indeed my servants will work with your servants, to prepare timber in abundance for me, for the house which I am about to build will be great and wonderful. Now behold, I will give to your servants, the woodsmen who cut the timber, 20,000 kors of crushed wheat and 20,000 kors of barley, and 20,000 baths of wine and 20,000 baths of oil.

content.paragraph: Solomon was known for his wisdom because God provided wisdom for whatever he set his hands to. When God grants wisdom, He provides for each area He guides us into.

For your sacred mission, God can do for you what He provided for Solomon and more. In Old Testament times, God didn't grant wisdom to everyone. In New Testament times, God offers His endless wisdom to anyone who wishes to seek it out.
When God works a project with you, He will point you to people of provision who are in place to assist you. Here are a few things He provided for Solomon that were already within his reach.

list.title: COOPERATION
list.description: from strangers who were foreigners in the land that agreed to help with the heavy lifting of the work project.

list.title: TEAMWORK
list.description: between nations and peoples as they worked side by side and labored together.

list.title: PARTNERSHIP
list.description: with rulers and authorities who were outside of his immediate circle but equipped to help.

list.title: PROVISION
list.description: was provided for Huam, King of Tyre, in exchange for the cedars from Lebanon and labor from his workforce.

reflection_questions: Who is within your reach that could lighten your load by lending a helping hand?
Whom do you need to approach to partner with to make you more effective?
Are there identifiable barriers or bottlenecks that are slowing you down?
conclusion: When God calls you to a work, He has provision planned and a team picked out to assist you; do you recognize them?

title: BATTLE PLAN YOUR DAY

verse.text: Then David numbered the people who were with him and set over them commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds. David sent the people out, one third under the command of Joab, one third under the command of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and one third under the command of Ittai the Gittite.

content.paragraph: Create a repeatable system for what is recurring daily. David was about to carry out a task he had many times before by readying himself for battle, and he had a system that brought him success.
Success in any endeavor requires advance preparation. Here is a simple approach that can help you set up each day for success.

list.title: PRIORITIZE
list.description: Delete, delegate, then dive in. Identify what “must” get done today, no matter what.

list.title: ORGANIZE
list.description: Take inventory of your resources and determine the scope of work for the day. Time block your day to ensure everything that is priority gets scheduled.

list.title: STRATEGIZE
list.description: Make a plan for each priority. An outline for a meeting will set an agenda and keep you focused.

reflection_questions: What issues typically sidetrack your focus during the day?
Do you have a success system that you follow?
Who is the most organized person you know? What is their success system?
conclusion: Those who plan ahead get ahead, and the opposite is also true.

title: WHO DO PEOPLE SAY THAT YOU ARE?

verse.text: Moreover, Husham said, 'You know your father and his men, that they are mighty men and they are fierce, like a bear robbed of her cubs in the field. And your father is an expert in warfare, and will not spend the night with the people. Behold, he has now hidden himself in one of the caves or in another place; and it will be when he falls on them at the first attack, that whoever hears it will say, 'There has been a slaughter among the people who follow Absalom.' And even the one who is valiant, whose heart is like the heart of a lion, will completely lose heart; for all Israel knows that your father is a mighty man and those who are with him are valiant men.'

content.paragraph: What is your reputation? David and his valiant men got a reputation for being fierce in battle. It started in the days of Goliath, continued while David was on the run from Saul, and continued in victory during David's reign as king.

Reputation can be built over years but lost over a single act. The Romans viewed character as the 'sum parts' of a person, while the Greeks viewed reputation like a stamp or symbol for what something 'looked like.' Reputation is who people think you are, but character is who you are.
Reputation has the power to go ahead of you to pave a path of favor and influence.

content.section_title: Ten Characteristics of a Good Reputation

list.title: Competence
list.description: Are they skilled and capable of doing the job?

list.title: Character
list.description: What is their total makeup?

list.title: Countability
list.description: Can they be counted on?

list.title: Contribution
list.description: What value do they add?

list.title: Charisma
list.description: Are people drawn to them?

list.title: Criticism
list.description: How do they handle failure?

list.title: Correctable
list.description: Are they teachable?

list.title: Celebration
list.description: How do they handle success?

list.title: Connection
list.description: Do they have good people skills?

list.title: Compassionate
list.description: Do they care for others?

reflection_questions: If you were to ask those closest to you, what adjectives would they use to describe your reputation?
What one word would you use to describe yourself and why?
Your life will likely be summed up in one sentence one day. If you could pick it, what would it be?
conclusion: Reputation is what others see; character is what God sees.

title: MANIPULATORS IN THE MARKETPLACE

verse.text: Absalom used to rise early and stand beside the way to the gate; and when any man had a suit to come to the king for judgment, Absalom would call to him and say, 'From what city are you?' And he would say, 'Your servant is from one of the tribes of Israel.' Then Absalom would say to him, 'See, your claims are good and right, but no man listens to you on the part of the king.' Moreover, Absalom would say, 'Oh that one would appoint me judge in the land, then every man who has any suit or cause could come to me and I would give him justice.'

content.paragraph: Watch those at the water cooler. Absalom used position and power to grow influence so that he might manipulate others for his personal benefit.

From the time a child is born, they learn how to manipulate their parents with a cry. The issue is not whether you wield the power of influence but whether it will be used for selfish or selfless reasons.
Absalom positioned himself in a way to steal the people's affections away from his father David so he could steal the throne.

list.title: THE MANIPULATOR
list.description: Uses the unhappiness of a situation to sway emotional support in their direction.

list.title: THE POWER POINTER
list.description: Seizes moments of negativity to elevate their influence and reduce the influence of authority.

list.title: THE COMPLAINT COLLECTOR
list.description: Perpetuates discontent by camping out at the water cooler or employee lounge.

reflection_questions: Can you sense when someone during conversation is trying to sway support toward themselves and away from the authorities in place?
What examples can you give of a right and wrong way you have used your influence?
What advice would you give to a new coworker who is being invited into the 'complaining crowd'?
conclusion: God hates murmuring and frowns on those that use the misfortune of others to advance themselves.

title: THE SUCCESS DRIFT

verse.text: Now when evening came David arose from his bed and walked around on the roof of the king's house, and from the roof he saw a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful in appearance.

content.paragraph: Wrong place—wrong time. In the times of war, a king was to be away from the comforts of the palace and in the field with his soldiers, leading and inspiring them. For David, he had drifted from the place he belonged and had fallen into a complacent lifestyle that led him to sleeping during the day and getting up at night. Being in the wrong place at the wrong time opened the door to David sinning with Bathsheba and then killing her husband to cover it up.
Notice the sequence of events that surrounded the king's fall from grace:

list.title: Comfort
list.description: Israel had not taken rest from her enemies, but David had.

list.title: Conflict
list.description: At the intersection of temptation, David failed to count the cost of his actions.

list.title: Cover-up
list.description: David tried to cover up his sin by getting Uriah to sleep with his wife, and later had him killed.

list.title: Confrontation
list.description: God confronted David head-on through the prophet Nathan.

list.title: Conviction
list.description: David was cut through to the heart and confessed his sin.

list.title: Consequence
list.description: Although God forgave David's sin, consequences included ongoing war throughout his reign.

reflection_questions: Is there any area of your life that you are getting 'pinged' from God that requires a course correction?
Success is an inside job—what specifically needs shoring up in your life?
Do you have a wandering friend or family member whom God is asking you to 'be a Nathan to' so you can speak into their life to pull them back from the consequence of sin?
conclusion: Everyone is prone to the success drift from time to time—God prefers a 'self-corrector' over one He must correct.

title: BE FIRST TO FACE THE GIANT

verse.text: Again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot; and he also was descended from the giants. When he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David's brother, killed him.

content.paragraph: You may only get a few 'giant opportunities' a year to prove yourself. David's nephew was one of a few Israelites who also killed a giant similar to David killing Goliath. However, David was the first to kill a giant. David becomes king, and those who killed giants after him are rarely mentioned. The one who goes first is remembered and honored as a pioneer and a leader.

Someone is always observing you while you work. Successful people distinguish themselves by going first, starting early, outperforming, and serving others. They are pioneers, not settlers; climbers, not part of the group that gets comfortable and camps out. God uses those who are willing to be aggressive and take action.

section_title: THE CHALLENGE TO FACE YOUR GIANT
reflection_questions: What is before you now that you are putting off but need to take action on?
Are there challenges that, when faced, God may use to brand your reputation with others?
Of your colleagues and coworkers, who stands out as a 'giant slayer' in your mind?
conclusion: Seizing smaller challenges is what prepares you for conquering the Goliaths in your life.

title: GET THE 'DAVID ANOINTING'

verse.text: And the LORD helped David wherever he went.

content.paragraph: Problems create promotion. When God wants to establish you, He will often use a challenge that no one else can solve but you in order to bring awareness of you to people of position and power. When God established King David in the eyes of his people, He used what kings often face— a challenge in war, even an enormous challenge.

God allows problems no one can solve but you, but not without His help. Without a problem, a solution is unneeded. Without a challenge, an overcomer's courage goes unnoticed. Without Goliath, David would not have had victory on a national stage.

section_title: HOW GOD USES CHALLENGES TO PROMOTE YOU

list.title: STAND UP
list.description: A problem that comes up that no one can solve, but you volunteer to take it on.

list.title: RAISE YOUR HAND
list.description: A relationship no one wants to handle, but you volunteer, are successful, and the high brass takes notice.

list.title: STEP FORWARD
list.description: A crisis that causes everyone fear, yet faith rises up in you. You step forward and face the challenge no one else would, and God is with you.

reflection_questions: Are there challenges you skirted in your past that later you observed someone else benefited from because they ran toward what you ran away from?
What problems or challenges might be hiding under the surface at work or in the marketplace that you have the insight to resolve?
What is the 'Goliath' in your life or problem your boss faces that God wants you to confront like David did?
conclusion: To elevate you in the marketplace, God presents challenges within your environment that require His involvement and your courage.

title: THE SIGN OF LOVE

verse.text: I will be a father to him and he will be a son to Me; when he commits iniquity, I will correct him with the rod of men and the strokes of the sons of men, but My lovingkindness shall not depart from him, as I took it away from Saul, whom I removed from before you.

content.paragraph: When the desire was birthed in David to build a house for God, God's response was that He would allow Solomon, who would come after him, to be the builder. God goes out of His way in His response to David to prove His love for David's future son when He uses words like 'love,' 'correction,' and 'establish.'

Pain is the great attention-getter, but God uses it as the master tutor also. It is impossible to be successful in business without the willingness to change, adapt, and shift our behavior on a continual basis.

list.title: Pause
list.description: Reflect, then respond—don't react.

list.title: Ask yourself
list.description: Is the input true?

list.title: Submit to correction
list.description: What change is needed?

list.title: Success
list.description: Thank God for the teachable moment, knowing He will work it together for your good in the future.

reflection_questions: When was the last time you experienced a degree of emotional pain as a result of correction?
Do you willingly receive constructive criticism, or does the messenger have to contend with defensiveness from you before you are open to input?
Do you view correction as an infringement on your 'rights' or as feedback as to how you can improve?
conclusion: God accepts you as you are yet loves you too much to leave you the way you are.

title: CELEBRATE TO APPRECIATE

verse.text: And they brought in the ark of God and placed it inside the tent which David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God. When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

content.paragraph: When something amazing happens in your life, do you celebrate? After David brought the Ark of God back to Israel, he threw a party and celebrated. Can you imagine everyone in the nation receiving a portion of food from the king? And then they celebrated with a Psalm of thanksgiving which rehearsed and revisited all the great things God had done for Israel.
Celebration creates momentum, and momentum creates more wins. Leaders are judged every month by their performance. Performance expectations require that you deliver every month.

reflection_questions: When is the last time you stopped down to celebrate something God has done in your ministry, career, or family?
Is there something your spouse or children have accomplished this month that you need to celebrate and acknowledge them for?
If you were to write God a Psalm of thanksgiving like the one found in 1 Chronicles 14, what would you write?
conclusion: Celebrating a win recharges and replenishes the soul, and God is a big partier.

title: A SOLUTION FOR EVERY PROBLEM

verse.text: It shall be when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, then you shall go out to battle, for God will have gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.

content.paragraph: God has a plan for your problem. Once again, David is asking God for advice, and once again, God is specific in answering David's query for a title to win. God is as concerned with helping His children in the marketplace as much as He is those in the ministry. As a son or daughter of the Highest, you can receive God's outstretched hand.
When you are not sure what to do, or you need a divine idea or instruction for what you are facing, follow these steps.

list.title: Get quiet and reach out!
list.description: Acknowledge to God that you need His help. His line is open and awaiting your call.

list.title: Lean in and listen closely!
list.description: You may hear a gentle whisper or God may paint a picture inside of you, or bring a memory to mind.

list.title: Follow!
list.description: Whatever you feel God is leading you to do, do it. God's title often comes in small steps.

reflection_questions: When you are in trouble, whom do you turn to first?
What challenge are you facing now that requires God's insight?
Does it matter if you make your query to God vocally or in your heart only?
conclusion: God delights when His kids reach out to Him, even for the small things.

title: ROOTS FOR A REASON

verse.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons and carpenters, to build a house for him. And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly exalted, for the sake of His people Israel.

content.paragraph: God desires to establish everyone in their destiny. The time had arrived for David to become king of Israel. For years, God delayed establishing David, knowing that there was a specific date and time He would all at once bring about the fulfillment of His plan for David's life.

When you are where God wants you to be, you will find that God will open doors, bring new people and resources into your life, increase your income and influence, deepen your roots within an organization and community, and accelerate His blessings in your life.

list.title: PLACE
list.description: He provides a place to live you can call your own.

list.title: PURPOSE
list.description: His purposes begin to unfold in your life, and you experience uncommon energy, wisdom, and insight in your lane of calling.

list.title: PRESENCE
list.description: An outpouring of His Presence increases and is known by the unexplainable favor you receive.

list.title: PLEASURE
list.description: You begin to feel His pleasure as you accomplish the work He has given you to do.

list.title: PROVISION
list.description: Provision is in the place God has called you to serve.

reflection_questions: Have there been seasons where you sensed God was establishing you?
What signaled to you that God was bringing about His purposes in your life?
As you interpret the seasons of your life, what do you discern God is doing or about to do through you or for you?
conclusion: God's blessings are waiting for you in the place of obedience.

title: THE DEPENDABILITY OF DAVID

verse.text: David became greater and greater, for the LORD God of hosts was with him.

content.paragraph: Devotion in relationship, coupled with commitment to obedience, unlocks God's divine favor. When David was 15, God chose him to be king and had Samuel anoint him. What was it about David that caused God to not only anoint him but remain with him, fight alongside him, and consider him a devoted friend?

David's devotion to his relationship with God and his dedication to obey whatever God told him to do created favor in whatever David put his hands to. Obedience is a serious currency in Heaven, and God richly rewards it. What has God asked you to do that you have not taken action on yet?

Procrastination kills deadlines, dreams, and careers. Have you noticed that when there is something you are delaying doing, the weight of doing it gets bigger and bigger, even compounding, until you get it done?

reflection_questions: What does partnership look like with God and you?
What have you left undone that needs to be done?
If you had to list off what you are waiting on God to do, what does His list look like of what He is waiting for you to do?
conclusion: Delayed obedience is disobedience, even on the things no one has told you to do that you know must be done.

title: THE NEW SHERIFF IN TOWN

verse.text: As the Lord lives, who has redeemed my life from all distress, when one told me, saying, ‘Behold, Saul is dead,' and thought he was bringing good news, I seized him and killed him in Ziklag, which was the reward I gave him for his news.

content.paragraph: When a shocking event happens, how do you respond? Do you get fearful, paralyzed, excited, or pause to “consider your ways”? A shift in power within an organization, a new decision-maker on the scene, or the death of someone close creates a shaking at the core of our being.

When there is a new sheriff in town, “consider your ways.” When there is a shift in authority, it's a signal to re-read the environment, re-learn how the one in authority thinks, and re-visit your assumptions.

content.section_title: Things to Consider When a New Authority Enters

list.title: VISION
list.description: What is the new vision? Pieces of the old regime may remain in place.

list.title: PRIORITIES
list.description: What are the new priorities, and what is no longer considered important?

list.title: EXPECTATIONS
list.description: What is expected of me? Ask the new decision maker or supervisor.

list.title: TODAY'S ACTIONS
list.description: What can you do today that will positively impact the new authority?

reflection_questions: How has the ground shaken under your feet with a new boss before?
When you go through an emotionally destabilizing event, what is your first response?
Some see change as bad, while others see God opening a door; what do you see?
conclusion: When the ground is shaking under your feet, leaders shift to adapt to the new environment.

title: THE CRAFTSMAN OF DESTINY

verse.text: David became greater and greater, for the LORD of hosts was with him.

content.paragraph: God is a master mentor who knows how to create His character in you. David was 15 when he was anointed by Samuel to be king, but it was not until the age of 30 that he would enter Jerusalem to rule as king over all Israel.

The muscle of perseverance is developed the moment you want to quit but keep going anyway. The day-to-day struggles you face as you walk into your destiny are the 'material' the master craftsman uses to chisel His character into you.

David had years of struggles—do you think he ever wanted to give up? God is looking for 'finishers.' Keep your eyes fixed on the future promise and persevere until God brings you into all of His purposes for your life.

reflection_questions: What struggles have you encountered that God is using to fashion you into His masterpiece?
What do you need to trust God for today and persevere through?
In what ways do you identify with David's 15-year journey from the fields of a shepherd to the steps of the palace?
conclusion: The muscle of perseverance only develops when you want to quit but then keep going.

title: THREE RS OF CREATING CONFIDENCE

verse.text: There we saw the giants there, the sons of Anak … and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.

content.paragraph: God struggles to get you to see yourself as He sees you. What troubled God when the 12 spies went in wasn't just their lack of faith in God but their lack of faith in themselves.
Joshua and Caleb came back with a report that said, in essence, 'Let's go; we can take them.' The other 10 didn't believe that, even with God's help, they could conquer the giants they faced.

How you see yourself determines your self-image and the ceiling of your effectiveness. Your internal self-talk and your self-image decide your confidence level. Without confidence in yourself, you will struggle to reach and attain all God has for you.
Confidence creates courage. Here are a few ways in which successful saints can create a healthy self-image that perpetuates confidence in themselves and in God.

list.title: READ
list.description: what God says about you in the Scriptures and choose to believe His report over your feelings.

list.title: REMIND
list.description: yourself of past victories in the Lord, how they were created, and then reproduce them. Nothing creates confidence and a healthy self-image like repeated success.

list.title: REPROGRAM
list.description: your failures and self-doubts by repurposing past hurts and failures into learning moments. God will help you.

reflection_questions: What memories or self-doubts chip away at your confidence?
When you think of your top 10 qualities, what adjectives come to mind?
What is God asking you to do that you've been putting off because you are doubting yourself?
conclusion: For those who tap into the confidence God has for them, nothing shall be impossible for them.

title: READ THE ROOM TO LEAD THE ROOM

verse.text: Then He told them a parable: 'Behold the fig tree and all the trees; as soon as they put forth leaves, you see it and know for yourselves that summer is now near. So you also, when you see these things happening, recognize that the kingdom of God is near.'

content.paragraph: Jesus reminds us that you can miss important events if your senses are not trained on what to look for. Your ability to read the room (your environment) starts with knowledge and awareness.
You must have the know-how (knowledge) of what you are looking for and a high level of awareness (wisdom) so that when signals are sent, you receive them.
Leaders learn to read the room so they can lead those in the room.
Knowledge and awareness are the keys to reading the room. Your eyes, ears, and heart can ascertain visible and invisible communication if you teach them to.

One of America's greatest business consultants of his time, Peter Drucker, said, 'Over 50% of communication is nonverbal.' Consider using a notepad to document the clues you pick up on during communication.

By studying people and their reactions to yourself and other communicators, your ability to read all that is being communicated will grow dramatically and quickly. If you invite the Holy Spirit to show you what He sees and hears, your ability to discern will fast-track supernaturally.

reflection_questions: Have you become aware of moments missed in a meeting? Maybe you thought to yourself, 'I wish I would have said…'
What are the most common communication cues you pick up on during communication?
As you reflect on significant conversations you've had in the last week, what moments during the conversation impacted you?
conclusion: Reading the room precedes leading the room.

title: THE GOD DOOR TO WITNESS

verse.text: I solemnly charge you in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who is to judge the living and the dead, and by His appearing and His kingdom: preach the word; be ready in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort, with great patience and instruction.

content.paragraph: Witness when the door is open. Doctors are told to 'help the patient right in front of them.' How do you know if the door to share your story of God's love is open?
If there is a need by someone close by, that is your cue that God has opened a door for you to share your story. A few other ways to witness include:

list.title: Be Alert
list.description: for a prompting by the Holy Spirit.

list.title: Observe Your Emotions
list.description: If you feel compassion toward them, reach out; this may be God's Spirit emoting through you.

list.title: Ask Questions
list.description: to ascertain the need.

list.title: Listen, Then Listen Some More
list.description: As you listen to them, what is God saying to you?

list.title: Learn by Asking Follow-up Questions
list.description: to areas of the conversation they are emphasizing.

list.title: Love Them by Sharing Your Story
list.description: God may guide you to share a similar situation you were in and how He helped you through it.

list.title: Hear What the Holy Spirit Would Lead You to Say
list.description: God will often bring a Bible story or Scripture to your memory, which is for them.

list.title: Offer to Pray for Them
list.description: People rarely refuse an invitation to come into contact with God.

reflection_questions: Whom is God prompting you to have a conversation with?
Whom are you feeling a burden for?
In what ways can you maintain a sensitivity to God's leading as you go through your day?
conclusion: God will use your witness as often as you let Him.

title: THE ART OF SELF-ENCOURAGEMENT

verse.text: But David strengthened himself in the LORD his God.

content.paragraph: Where do you go when you are hurting? David had come to a low point in his life. He was still on the run from Saul, and while away from his home base of Ziklag, Amalekites had taken the women and children away, including David's family.

The people were so embittered against him that they thought to stone him. Is there something or a series of circumstances you have recently faced that has caused you to feel greatly distressed or depressed?
Learning the “art of encouraging” oneself is one of the most important life skills a person can learn. You, and you alone, are responsible for motivating yourself and keeping yourself energized.

Everyone faces emotional ups and downs. Salespeople face rejection when cold calling, managers struggle with rising expectations, employees struggle with injustice, and the list goes on. Regardless of the circumstance, at some point, you will need to learn how to recharge your own emotional tank on the fly.
When David was feeling down, he turned to God as his source for renewal.
The word 'encourage' comes from two words. 'En' means to 'add to.' And 'courage' means 'strengthen.' So, to do as David did means to turn to God, and He will ADD STRENGTH to you.

content.section_title: Ways to Strengthen Yourself in the Lord

list.title: Listen to Christian Music
list.description: and let the words wash over your mind.

list.title: Read the Bible Slowly
list.description: as if you are 'praying' through the Scriptures.

list.title: Rehearse 'God Memories' of Victory
list.description: Talk to yourself about God working through your circumstances in the past.

reflection_questions: When was the last time you were down and out—did you run to or away from God?
Have you developed a way to 'strengthen yourself' when you are feeling weak or worn out?
Whom can you strengthen today with your words of encouragement and empowerment?
conclusion: The more I talk to myself about God working through my circumstances in the past, the more power I have in the present.

title: LET GOD SPEAK THROUGH YOU

verse.text: It will lead to an opportunity for your testimony. So make up your minds not to prepare beforehand to defend yourselves; for I will give you utterance and wisdom which none of your opponents will be able to resist or refute.

content.paragraph: Jesus promised persecution. At some point, you will suffer for being a follower of Christ and need to give an account of WHY you believe what you believe.

Jesus told His disciples not to prepare to defend themselves but to let Him lead them in the moment. Have you had an experience in conversations or from a stage where you felt God flowing through you, and the words just came to you?

As words effortlessly came, you knew it was Him. Jesus can provide the words and wisdom, not only when speaking of Him but in everyday business situations you will face, for the 'mind of Christ' dwells in you.
You have a story God wants you to tell. To testify is to tell of what you've seen and heard. The disciples walked with Jesus for 3 ½ years and had a firsthand account of the life of Christ.
While you cannot always prepare your words, you can prepare yourself with prayer. Praying through precedes breaking through.

reflection_questions: How do you know when God is speaking through you?
How have you experienced God speaking through you 'in the moment'?
Do you believe there are people God wants you to speak to on His behalf this week?
conclusion: Prayer is the best form of preparation when the stakes are at their highest. Praying through precedes breaking through.

title: LOOSE LIPS SINK SHIPS

verse.text: Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth; Keep watch over the door of my lips.

content.paragraph: David went through seasons of insecurity and fragility to the point where even what would come out of his mouth concerned him at times. When we are spread too thin or under great pressure, the lid over our heart can sometimes fly open unexpectedly, and we can blurt things out that have not been thought through or considered and, therefore, can do more damage than good.

Just as David referred to the “door of his lips,” what we say and how we say it can determine whether doors of opportunity open or close, whether people are attracted to us or repelled by us. The words we use create the environment around us—they can create connection or conflict and build relationships or destroy them.

The first step in taking back your mind is to ask God to keep watch over what is brewing down below and practice the 2-second rule. This is something I like to practice when the lid over my lips is feeling loose. The 2-second rule creates a 'pause' in the space between when someone speaks to me and my response.

reflection_questions: When in recent memory do you recall speaking when you should have remained silent?
